subject: Junit Newbie
msgSnippet: Hi Group, Just started to use JUnit on my first Java project at work. Got it setup and outputting into message view of JBuilder. All the articles I read say to
messageBody:
Hi Group,

Just started to use JUnit on my first Java project at work. Got it setup and outputting into message view of JBuilder.

All the articles I read say to replace any System.out.println() calls with test cases. I am unable to get this to work when
the System.out.println() is contained within the Catch statement of a Try/Catch block.

In the code below, this is the line "System.out.println("Unable to load Driver Class");"

===================================================
package testjdbc;

import java.sql.*;

public class JDBCSample
{
public JDBCSample()
{
}

public boolean loadDriver()
{
try
{
// This is where we load the driver by calling in a class through its
// string name using the forName method.
Class.forName("oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver");
}
catch (ClassNotFoundException e)
{
System.out.println("Unable to load Driver Class");
}
}
}
===================================================

I'm sure there is a simple explanation to this, but I am unable to work it out.

Any help is greatlly appreciated.

Cheers,
Andrew



--
